intro: Senecio doria var. macrocephalus, commonly known as the giant Senecio, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in dense, woolly hairs. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and also covered in a thick layer of fine, white绒毛. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
